content.question:
Mr. Berndt is teaching his AP Psychology class about the nervous system.Â 
Which of the following statements would best help students accurately differentiate between the primary roles of glial cells and neurons?

choices.label: Glial cells release chemicals known as neurotransmitters into the synapses, while neurons provide structural support.
Glial cells provide support, insulation, and waste removal functions for neurons, while neurons create and transmit electrical impulses between cells.
Glial cells and neurons are both involved in processing sensory information, while primarily glial cells receive and process sensory input from the external environment.
Glial cells are found in both the peripheral and central nervous systems, while neurons are only found in the central nervous system.

content.answer: Glial cells provide support, insulation, and waste removal functions for neurons, while neurons create and transmit electrical impulses between cells.
